Since this is a SEAFOOD restaurant, I let them show me a sample of their expertise.

1st meal  - Catfish, fried.  Overly coated, and once cooled, became rock-hard.  Too salty.
  - Bitter melon with beef.  Beef not tender, overall was too bitter.
  - Beef stew in a fired hot pot.  Meat had flavor, not the broth.
  - Deep fried pumpkin squash.  Mediocre.  No wonder it was FREE.
  - Finally, lobster noodles.  O.K.  These ingredients have natural flavor.

2nd meal - A few more different dishes, to round out their offerings.
- Tripe in black bean sauce.  Kind of bland.
- Prawns with Jalapenos.  Had O.K. flavor via MSG.
- Hung Tao Yee Won Ton - Bland, with thin broth.  Much better at Kirin Restaurant on Geary.

PROS  - Predictable meal.  Quality, taste, freshness was just O.K.  Would eat here for a rice plate.  Also, they feature Beef Tripe, one of my favorites that is becoming harder to find.

CONS  I feel like I have to be "on guard" any time that I come by.  The woman who hangs out by the front door is not only annoying in that she demands to know if you're going to order something, and if you do, asks, "why don't you order more?".  Additionally, her voice is a most irritating kind of raspiness as she literally YELLS to all around her.  Also, I am rather annoyed that the staff will exert so much pressure to "upsell" their more expensive dishes, albeit only upon a select group of customers.  The last time that I was there, the 2 of us were quite astounded that the waiter, owner, owner's wife, etc. ALL approached us with the purpose of "upselling".  Such pressure!!  Meanwhile, a woman with her 3 children were left alone, as though the staff knew that she was on a very thin budget, with NO upselling attempted.  In fact, this woman ordered 2 low-end dishes, which totaled about 12 dollars for 4 people, while the two of us spent 38 dollars.  In fact, on my second visit to obtain a printed menu, the woman seemed annoyed that I had come in just to "not buy anything".  I was planning a dinner visit that evening, but as I promised her, I did show up later.

As a result, I have come to the conclusion, after 5 visits to Superior Palace for dinner, that while their specials are a good value, they come at a higher cost... that is the higher cost of their multiple attempts to upsell me.

Enter at your caution.  Don't say that anyone didn't try to warn you.  It seems that even in the most subtle way, they want you to feel uncomfortable.  For example, for 2 people to order 5 dishes at full price, and the same comment is asked by the order-taker:  IS THAT ALL?  I am convinced that even if the 2 of us ordered 30 dishes, they would STILL attempt to sell us just one more high-end dish.

As for me... never again.  If I want to be abused at a Chinese restaurant, there are many others that will mistreat me for far less money.
author: David J.

description: The quality of the food has been better the last couple times that I've gone. It seems like they're trying to improve their customer service too. It used to be that they'd present you a dish with all the residual cooking liquid or oil with the dish. Last time that I went, there was very little liquid at the bottom of the dish.
author: S P.

description:
there ain't anythin superior bout this place ( i wonder if anyone else said that already).

it's a mediocre spot with plane walls and dim yellowish lighting.  to me with the outside onning and shiny red brick tiles, it would seem that this place could easily look much grander than it is right now.  kinda sad in my opnion.  i think it jus doesn't spell out elegance, its like telling us, here we are, you wanna eat here?  fine go ahead.


"these are hard times"  but the food is decent.  i guess you get what you pay for.  And suprisingly, there isn't a dish that stands out amazingly.  we actually came here one time because south seafood was packed and had a wedding going on (those idiots were greedy and still took customers when there was an ongoing wedding with all the ruckus of banging chopsticks and ear piercing chinese singing)

but this was a backup sort of.  and the walnut prawns are sorta dried and looked not so fresh.  and seroiusly.  to me, you can't be serving wack walnut prawns, that's like everyone's favorite.  sweet lardish mayo on oily crisp prawns, with honey glazed walnuts??? you know each and every person will look at those as key.  

but for a cheap mediocre dinner, this place i guess can do it.  but definitely, i suggest making the inside just a tad nicer.  add some more lighting or mirrors or something.  but hey, i'm no expert.
author: Vincent K.

description: typical chinese restraunt. Loud, waiter running around like chicken with head cut off. (Ain't enough servers to serve the b-u-s-y place. Food is okie, a little salty at time. My fave here is the hot hot eggplant with tofu... yummy clay pot with rice, and garlic chicken with like this weird mustard sauce they serve it with. If u have a group, eat from the family dinner, cheap and you get pretty decent food.
author: Monika T.

description: I guess it's good because it was packed with the locals. We were here as part of a BIG group (4 tables) and apparantly the Deluxe menu was ordered for the food kept on coming and coming. I think we had a total of about 10 dishes and we were full after about the 6th. Everything was pretty good. Stand-outs boths ways were the roasted Duck which was agreed by all as one the best we've had and the cold chicken on the opposite end (blah). Considering they were packed plus our big group the food came out quickly and over-all service was pretty good for the type of resturant.
author: Ed L.

description: I've been here a few times.   The food is good.  The fried eggplant is great!  The best I've ever had.  Try it!  The service sucks.  You have to work hard to get their attention.  It's a small place, with tables very close to one another, and can get busy during dinner time.  I'd make a reservation for large groups.  There's also a small room off to the side that fits 3 or 4 large tables that you could have a party in.
author: Stacey L.

description: Very good Chinese food which arrives quite speedily. The restaurant specializes in seafood, which was excellent, and they give you a lot of food.  This is a very Chinese place, however, so it's best experienced with a large crowd, so that you can taste many dishes.
author: Ray Y.

description: The food here is fresh and tasty and not too greasy. It is nothing fancy, but a pretty good deal for family dinners (there's crab or lobster on the $48 dinner for 6-8 people). The cleanliness is a definite plus-I avoid the popular places like Best Panda because I lose my appetite when it's so messy and dirty! Friendly servers when we went made it a more pleasant dining experience too.
author: Gale H.

description: Located in the outer richmond, parking isn't always easy to find but meters are free after 6pm so keep that in mind in searching for a parking spot.  The restaurant looks ok on the interior - nothing memorable but it's fine.Tables are covered with paper placemats - great for drawing on if you are so inclined.  The menu has a variety of different items. Food is good, not too salty or greasy.  Portions are reasonably sized.  We had a seafood clay pot dish that was tasty, chicken chow fun, two different vegetable dishes (tender and fresh), beef and green beans (a bit oily), soft tofu and seafood on some sort of green leaf (good flavoring but mushy - likely should have expected that since soft tofu does not hold well together in cooking), sweet and sour pork, fried whole fish, and some fried rice.  Overall the food is fine. The service isn't great but that's not unusual.  Try not to get seated right in the path where the food comes in.  The tea wasn't strong or particularly tasty.  Worth trying.
author: A L.

description: One of the worst restaurants I've ever been to - I really didn't want to say this, but there was in fact a bug in the noodles. They were apologetic about it and gave us a new plate of noodles, but it was disgusting.
author: Judy L.

description: What can I say.... my relatives tend to be avid customers to this restaurant when we have the large family gatherings. We've gone to this location since when I was in elementary school over 20 years ago and have seen the place change hands multiple times. If I recall the current owners are the 6th ones from when a family friend owned the place. The location is difficult to obtain parking if you drive, especially for dinner since many other restaurants are nearby. The food isn't outstanding and the service is spotty at times. We normally order the set dinner menus, where there is a selection of 8-10 dishes to get a good sampling of different food items. Their soups, fried rice and vegetable dishes are always consistant. Their shrimp with honey walnut prawns is pretty good. Green onion & and ginger crab is ok, but their fish can be very bad unless you pick out of the fresh tank. Overall they are pretty cheap for the amount of food if you need to feed a large group. If you are looking for quality food items (special order menu) and more specialized chinese food I prefer Lucky Dragon down the street.
author: Derrick W.

description:
Wanted to have try some seafood for lunch, so I went out there for take out. 
Got there a little over 1pm and the place was quite busy. 
I sat by the register waiting for the waiter. I noticed that there were only 2 of them for the whole restaurant. No hostess, just the 2 waiters. 
The waiters kept walking passed me for few times. I waited patiently thinking that they were busy. 
Funny thing, NONE of them seem to have noticed me, it seems like they were trying very hard to avoid eye contact. 
Now I know they were busy and all, but I was hoping they would at least acknowledge my present. Nothing, nada. 
Waited for about 10 minutes and I finally walked over to the waiter station in the back area. 
Asked them if I needed to go to the kitchen myself to order food. 
At this point, I was very annoyed. 
One of the waiter then asked me if I wanted to eat-in or take out. 
I told them they should have more staff working. He didn't say anything back. 

I know it's a chinese restaurant (which most places have bad services) but still, the waiter should have tried to at least acknowledge customers, even when they were busy. 

Speaking of busy, I also put blame on the owner. I mean, the place is constantly busy right? You would think that the owner would care about their customer and have enough staff. 
Please, spend a little money that you make to hire more people, good food alone won't be not enough in the long term. 

I left without any food with me. I think I would rather go to another chinese rest. Horrible service. The worst.
author: B H.
